qas.question: What other rights were equal to orthodox nobles?
What social pressure was pressing down the people?
What greatly eased the cultural pressure towards Catholicism.
What year was the union of brest

context: The Orthodox nobles' rights were nominally equal to those enjoyed by <a0_0>Polish and Lithuanian nobility<a0_0/>, but there was a cultural pressure to <a1_0>convert to Catholicism<a1_0/>, that was greatly eased in <a3_0>1596<a3_0/> by the <a2_0>Union of Brest<a2_0/>. See for example careers of Senator Adam Kisiel and Jerzy Franciszek Kulczycki.
